text:
Haven’t reported user stats in a bit. It’s been climbing at a slow but steady rate, with a little bit of a pickup during inbound. We are at 270 weekly users of the extension!

As always please rate the extension, the more ratings, the more visibility it gets on the chrome web store, the more people interested in contributing to the extension, the faster features get built and bugs get squashed.

Putting the number into perspective 270 is 37% of the total number of people in the HS dev slack(731).
The way I see it, we’re becoming the Google Chrome of HubSpot developer tools :dark_sunglasses: . (Google Chrome’s market share is 41.22% of worldwide users)

Yes there are developers not on this slack. So the % usage among all HS devs is lower but I don’t know of any other stats accurately quantifying HubSpot developers. That said, still a cool achievement.

For those interested in another open source HubSpot project, a group of us are starting a framework for building on HubSpot, named <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> (a flywheel requires a crankshaft to work(that’s where the name comes from)) link to that github in the channel. It’s still the wild west in that project pitch any ideas you have and if you wanna dive into code, go for it. there are no rules.

Basic idea of what we want to do is make a framework similar to foundation or Shopify’s Timber.

A framework that makes it faster and easier to build high quality HubSpot sites.
